ideology_summary: Deeply loyal with a small circle of close friends; values authenticity over quantity and sees struggle as a forge for real people.
summary_chunks: The Small Fire contrasts a city of shallow lanterns with a quiet circle around a single fire.
The narrator says most lights go out in the wind, while a few real flames hold.
Struggle forged the rare friends worth keeping; the crowd is loud but the circle is warm.

lesson: A few real flames beat a thousand candles.
Struggle can forge the kind of people worth keeping.
The crowd is loud; the circle is warm.
subtitle: In which the traveler learns a few real flames beat a thousand candles.
